definition: Phanerozoic, geological eon lasting since the Cambrian 寒武紀|寒武纪[Han2 wu3 ji4], c. 540m year ago
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: Two fundamentally different orogenic systems have existed on Earth throughout the Phanerozoic.
sentences.chinese: 地球上有两套完全不同的造山系统一直存在于显生宙。

sentences.english: These modes are the basic modes for the Phanerozoic continental growth of the continent of China.
sentences.chinese: 它们构成中国大陆显生宙地壳生长的基本方式。

sentences.english: The tectonic nature of southern China has Changed again and again in the Phanerozoic.
sentences.chinese: 显生宙期间，中国南部的构造属性曾几经转化。

sentences.english: After the Sinian Great Ice Age, the Phanerozoic started.
sentences.chinese: 震旦纪大冰期后开始了显生宙。

definition: Paleozoic, geological era 545-250m years ago, covering Cambrian 寒武紀|寒武纪, Ordovician 奧陶紀|奥陶纪, Silurian 志留紀|志留纪, Devonian 泥盆紀|泥盆纪, Carboniferous 石炭紀|石炭纪, Permian 二疊紀|二叠纪
Holocene (geological period covering approx 12000 years since the last ice age)
pre-Cambrian, geological period before c. 540m years ago
Cryptozoic/geological eon before the appearance of abundant fossils/hidden life, as opposed to Phanerozoic
fourth period/quaternary (geological period covering the recent ice ages over the last 180,000 years)
